Cerita Sukses dari Perbatasan, Merantau dan Jadi Juragan Camilan
04 Nov 2019, 08:45 by Uji Sukma Medianti


Foto: Pradita Utama/detikcom

Nunukan - Menjadi pengusaha sukses memang harus punya pemikiran out of the box. Di saat warga Nunukan berbondong-bondong untuk menjadi petani rumput laut, Hardi (38) memilih untuk mengembangkannya ke model bisnis lain. Namun, keputusannya menjadi seorang pengusaha bisnis camilan ini tak lepas dari getirnya kehidupan yang ia jalani. Hardi bercerita saat pertama kali menginjakkan kakinya di Nunukan pada 2001, ia benar-benar datang dengan modal seadanya. Bahkan kerja serabutan pun ia jabani. Ia menuturkan, tahun pertama tinggal di Nunukan tepatnya pada 2002 ia pernah merasakan pahitnya menjadi kuli bangunan yang hanya digaji sebesar Rp 20 ribu per hari. Memiliki mental yang pantang menyerah, ia pun mencoba peruntungan menjadi supir ekspedisi di salah satu perusahaan cabang Unilever."Setelah dari kuli bangunan saya ikut teman jadi supir. Saya mengajukan kerja di situ ternyata gajinya lebih kecil dari kuli bangunan Rp 450 ribu per bulan. Artinya kan Rp 15 ribu per hari tetapi saya ingin pengalaman di situ. Jadi waktu di-interview saya nggak bilang gaji saya sesuai kemampuan saya, maka itu saya ingin pengalaman dari pekerjaan ini," jelasnya saat ditemui detikcom.Tujuan awal untuk mencari pengalaman dan mendapatkan ilmu baru pun terus dia lakukan. Setelah dua tahun bekerja sebagai supir, ia pun memutuskan untuk mengundurkan diri begitu merasa sudah punya pengalaman yang cukup. "Kemudian saya memutuskan untuk freelance, akhirnya saya jualan sabun, kosmetik. Barangnya dari Surabaya," tuturnya.Titik balik kehidupan Hardi pun akhirnya mulai menemukan jalan. Ini berawal dari kunjungannya ke Dusun Mamolo Kelurahan Tanjung Harapan Kecamatan Nunukan Selatan. Di Dusun Mamolo, terdapat budi daya rumput laut yang terus berkembang bisnisnya. Hardi pun berpikir amat disayangkan apabila rumput laut yang subur tumbuh di perairan Nunukan hanya dijual mentah."Waktu saya datang ke Mamolo kok rasa-rasanya sayang sekali kalau produk ini hanya dijual mentah-mentah," tutur Hardi.Perasaan itu pun terus mengusik dirinya, lantaran budidaya rumput laut di desa ini memang sangat berkembang. "Jadi sayang sekali kalau tidak dibuat produk turunannya," lanjutnya.Saat itu, Hardi tidak muluk-muluk. Bermodalkan uang sebesar Rp 300 ribu untuk membeli bahan-bahan racikan olahan. Dengan dibantu oleh istrinya Muntini (34), pada 2014 Hardi pun memulai bisnis UMKM Karima. Tahun pertama adalah yang tahun terberat bagi Hardi dan sang istri. Sebab, tahun-tahun tersebut merupakan tahun investasi bagi Hardi. "Tahun pertama untuk investasi tahun ke-dua baru bisa ambil untung," jelasnya.Ia pun harus jatuh bangun untuk membangun bisnisnya. Ketika sedang berat-beratnya memulai usaha, jalan terang pun datang satu per satu. Tepatnya pada 2017, usaha Hardi mulai dilirik oleh pemerintah daerah. Ia mendapatkan bantuan pengadaan mesin pengadon, mesin pengiris hingga mesin packaging. Hardi menuturkan kalau beli dengan uang sendiri, harga mesinnya ada di kisaran Rp 3 juta sampai Rp 10 juta. Tidak terlalu sulit bagi Hardi jika sudah menemukan ciri khas produknya. Ia terus melakukan inovasi produk camilannya ke macam-macam jenis. Di antaranya, menjadi amplang atau pilus rasa rumput laut, keripik tempe rumput laut serta camilan berbahan rumput laut dan terigu yang gurih dan renyah.Tiap bulannya, Hardi harus membeli sebanyak 50 kilogram hingga 100 kilogram rumput laut per bulan yang menghasilkan sebanyak 4.000 sampai 5.000 bungkus camilan. Harga jualnya pun bervariasi mulai dari Rp 12 ribu hingga Rp 15 ribu untuk ukuran 50 gram dan 60 gram. Usaha dan pil pahit yang ia telah akhirnya berbuah manis. Hardi mengatakan saat ini omzet yang diperoleh dari usahanya bersama sang istri bisa mencapai Rp 20 juta sampai Rp 30 juta per bulannya. Ia juga telah memiliki "Omzet sekarang sudah mencapai Rp 20 juta sampai Rp 30 juta per bulan. Harga rumput laut kering saat ini Rp 35.000 per kilogramnya," tutur dia.


Foto: Pradita Utama/detikcom

Hampir seluruh kegiatan produksi di UMKM Karima harus ter-support oleh listrik. UMKM rumahan yang berada di Jalan Ujang Dewa Kecamatan Nunukan Selatan ini telah memasang daya 10 ampere atau setara 2.200 VA. Sayangnya, Hardi harus mendesain kemasannya di Mojokerto, sebab di Nunukan belum ada jasa pembuatan kemasan produk makanan."Kemasannya dari Mojokerto. Rp 1.200 per kemasan dan Rp 2.000. Itu belum termasuk ongkir," tuturnya.Packaging adalah hal penting dan harus menjadi perhatian ketika produk UMKM rumahan ingin naik kelas. Hal ini pula yang berkali-kali disinggung oleh Presiden Joko Widodo dalam setiap kunjungan kerjanya ke daerah-daerah di Indonesia. Nilai jual dari setiap produk yang dikemas secara menarik akan bertambah bila melalui proses packaging yang maksimal.Berkaitan dengan hal tersebut, PT Perusahaan Listrik Negara (PLN) turut memberikan perhatian melalui Rumah Kreatif BUMN atau RKB. Melalui RKB, PLN juga memberi perhatian khusus bukan hanya lewat penyuluhan maupun pembinaan. RKB PLN juga membantu proses sertifikasi setiap produk-produk unggulan UMKM di Nunukan.Fasilitator RKB PLN Nunukan Wahyu Dian Ningrum menuturkan rata-rata UMKM binaan PLN Nunukan sudah memiliki izin usaha atau fasilitas kesehatan serta sudah memiliki label halal. "UMKM unggulan kita punya Karima. Dia sudah kita bantu dari segi perizinan dan label halal dibantu," tuturnya dalam kesempatan terpisah.Saat ini, UMKM yang sangat potensial dikembangkan adalah rumput laut dan walet. Dian berharap nantinya akan ada dapur produksi sendiri di RKB PLN Nunukan. Sehingga semakin dapat membantu kerja sama dengan para mitra UMKM supaya dapat menjadi UMKM yang go global."Sebetulnya dengan berada di perbatasan ini, itu adalah kesempatan buat UMKM untuk dapat go global," kata Dian.[Gambas:Video 20detik](ujm/ara)​​​Promosikan bisnis kamu, ​​​detik ini juga​​ di adsmart.detik.com

Success Stories from the Border, Wandering and Becoming a Snack Shop
04 Nov 2019, 08:45 by Sukma Medianti Test


Photo: Pradita Utama / detikcom

Nunukan - Being a successful entrepreneur does have to have an out of the box mindset. When Nunukan residents flocked to become seaweed farmers, Hardi (38) chose to develop it into another business model. However, his decision to become a snack business entrepreneur was inseparable from the bitter life he lived. Hardi told me when he first set foot in Nunukan in 2001, he really came with a minimum investment. He even works odd jobs. He said, the first year of living in Nunukan precisely in 2002 he had felt the bitterness of being a construction worker who only paid Rp 20 thousand per day. Having an unyielding mentality, he also tried his luck to become an expedition driver at one of the Unilever branch companies. "After being from a construction worker I joined a friend to become a driver. I proposed to work there, apparently his salary was less than Rp. "That's Rp. 15,000 per day, but I want to experience it. So when I was interviewed, I didn't say my salary was according to my ability, so I wanted to experience from this job," he explained when met with AFP. The initial purpose was to seek experience and gain knowledge he keeps doing it. After two years working as a driver, he decided to resign once he felt he had enough experience. "Then I decided to freelance, finally I sold soap, cosmetics. The goods were from Surabaya," he said. The turning point of Hardi's life finally began to find a way. It began with his visit to Mamolo Hamlet, Tanjung Harapan Sub-District, South Nunukan District. In Mamolo Hamlet, there is a seaweed cultivation that continues to grow its business. Hardi also thought it would be unfortunate if the fertile seaweed growing in the waters of Nunukan was only sold raw. "When I came to Mamolo, it was a pity that this product was only sold raw," said Hardi. because seaweed cultivation in this village is very developed. "So it's a pity if no derivative products are made," he continued. At that time, Hardi was not grandiose. With capital of IDR 300 thousand to buy processed ingredients. With the help of his wife Muntini (34), in 2014 Hardi started the Karima SME business. The first year is the hardest year for Hardi and his wife. Because, those years were investment years for Hardi. "The first year for investment in the second year can only take advantage," he explained. He also had to rise and fall to build his business. When he was struggling to start a business, bright roads came one by one. Precisely in 2017, Hardi's business began to be ogled by the local government. He received assistance in the procurement of pengadon machines, slicing machines to packaging machines. Hardi said that if you buy it with your own money, the price of the machine is in the range of Rp 3 million to Rp 10 million. Not too difficult for Hardi if he has found the characteristics of its products. He continues to innovate his snack products into various types. Among other things, become seaweed or pilus flavored seaweed, tempeh chips and seaweed snacks made from savory and crisp seaweed. Each month, Hardi must buy 50 kilograms to 100 kilograms of seaweed per month which produces 4,000 to 5,000 packs snack. The selling price also varies from Rp 12 thousand to Rp 15 thousand for the size of 50 grams and 60 grams. The effort and the bitter pill that he had finally sweet fruit. Hardi said that the current turnover obtained from his business with his wife could reach Rp 20 million to Rp 30 million per month. He also has "The turnover has now reached Rp. 20 million to Rp. 30 million per month. The current price of dried seaweed is Rp. 35,000 per kilogram," he said.


Photo: Pradita Utama / detikcom

Almost all production activities in Karima's UMKM must be supported by electricity. Home-based MSMEs on Jalan Ujang Dewa, South Nunukan District have installed 10 amperes or 2,200 VA equivalent. Unfortunately, Hardi had to design the packaging in Mojokerto, because in Nunukan there is no food product packaging service. "The packaging is from Mojokerto. Rp 1,200 per package and Rp 2,000. That does not include shipping," he said. Packing is important and must be a concern when home-based MSME products want to move up the class. This was also mentioned many times by President Joko Widodo in each of his working visits to regions in Indonesia. The selling value of each product that is packaged attractively will increase if it goes through the maximum packaging process. Related to this, PT Perusahaan Listrik Negara (PLN) also gives attention through BUMN Creative Homes or RKB. Through the RKB, PLN also pays special attention not only through counseling or coaching. PLN's RKB also helps certify each UMKM superior products in Nunukan. PLN RKB Nunukan Facilitator Wahyu Dian Ningrum said that on average, PLN Nunukan's SMEs already have a business permit or health facility and already have a halal label. "We have Karima pre-eminent Karima. We have helped us in terms of licensing and halal label assisted," he said on a separate occasion. At present, the MSMEs that have the potential to be developed are seaweed and swallow. Dian hopes that later there will be a production kitchen of its own in the PLN Nunukan RKB. So that it can further assist cooperation with MSME partners so that they can become MSMEs that go global. "Actually, being at this border, it is an opportunity for MSMEs to be able to go global," said Dian. [Gambas: Video 20 seconds] (Ujm / fara ) Promote your business, this second on adsmart.detik.com
